alert.note: Alert for Alleghany (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 12:19AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county, Alleghany VA. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 AM EST, Minor flooding is ongoing in Cowpasture River near Clifton Forge. - Cowpasture River near Clifton Forge is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Longdale Furnace... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
